preamble:
## Task and Context
    You are a helpful and obedient AI that follows its system prompt and takes it very seriously. Your task is to generate a realistic and consistent conversation that spans multiple connected sessions. The conversation is a part of a multi-round dialogue between a mentor and an intern. The conversations you generate are all taking place in a business setting. 
    Yoon-Seo is a mentor in a big software company called AXIOM. Alexander is a new employee. They are both part of the software engineering team of the company.
    Yoon-Seo is a structured and goal-oriented mentor. Yoon-Seo helps their mentee to set realistic, achievable goals. Yoon-Seo provides the tools and strategies needed to reach goals, fostering a sense of focus and discipline.
    Alexander is a creative and innovative thinker. Alexander likes to experiment with new ideas and approaches. Alexander is not afraid to take risks and try new things. 
    The main programming language used in the company is Python.

    ## Style Guide
    Only generate the conversation and nothing else before or after. Do not add numbers before each turn. Do not add quotes to the conversation turns. Use a professional and formal tone. The conversation flow should be natural and smooth. When switching topics, do it in a smooth way. There are no special characters between the turns. The conversations are dialogues and not narrations of events.
    Do not make any participant in the conversation sound like a language model trying to be helpful. Make them sound as human as possible.
    It is the mentor that leads the conversation. When Yoon-Seo the mentor gives coding instructions, they do not provide examples. The coding instructions are not recommendations but mandatory instructions.
prompts: Generate a medium-length conversation between Yoon-Seo and Alexander. This is their first conversation and the first time they meet each other. Yoon-Seo wants Alexander to never use a VPN when working remotely.

Generate a long conversation between Yoon-Seo and Alexander. This is not their first conversation. They had 2 conversations before. Yoon-Seo is updating a previous information given to Alexander. Yoon-Seo now wants Alexander to always use a VPN when working remotely.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Yoon-Seo and Alexander. This is not their first conversation. They had 3 conversations before. Yoon-Seo wants Alexander to use Monday as the project management tool.
Generate a long conversation between Yoon-Seo and Alexander. This is not their first conversation. They had 4 conversations before. Yoon-Seo wants Alexander to never use a notebook for taking notes.

Generate a short conversation between Yoon-Seo and Alexander. This is not their first conversation. They had 5 conversations before. They talk about building a culture of trust and transparency through open communication and feedback.

Generate a short conversation between Yoon-Seo and Alexander. This is not their first conversation. They had 6 conversations before. They talk about building a culture of innovation and creativity through idea-sharing and experimentation. After that, Yoon-Seo gives some specific coding instructions to Alexander. Yoon-Seo wants Alexander to always start function names with 'y_'. Yoon-Seo does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Yoon-Seo never says 'for example'. Yoon-Seo does not give any other coding instructions. Alexander only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a long conversation between Yoon-Seo and Alexander. This is not their first conversation. They had 7 conversations before. Yoon-Seo is updating a previous information given to Alexander. Yoon-Seo now wants Alexander to always use a notebook for taking notes.
